variables.input:
fetch dt.entity.kubernetes_cluster
| fields entity.name
| sort entity.name asc

fetch dt.entity.kubernetes_node
| fields id, node.name = entity.name
| filter in(id, classicEntitySelector(concat("type(KUBERNETES_NODE),toRelationship.isClusterOfNode(type(KUBERNETES_CLUSTER),entityName.equals(",$Cluster,"))")))
| summarize collectDistinct(node.name)
| fieldsAdd `collectDistinct(node.name)` = arraySort(`collectDistinct(node.name)`, direction: "ascending")

fetch dt.entity.kubernetes_node
| filter entity.name==$Node
| filter in(id, classicEntitySelector(concat("type(KUBERNETES_NODE),toRelationship.isClusterOfNode(type(KUBERNETES_CLUSTER),entityName.equals(", $Cluster,"))")))
| fields id

6.title: CPU Utilization

leftYAxisSettings.label: Kubernetes: Container - CPU usage • Kubernetes: Node - CPU allocatable

7.title: Memory Utilization

leftYAxisSettings.label: Kubernetes: Container - working set memory • Kubernetes: Node - memory allocatable

8.title: Pods Utilization

leftYAxisSettings.label: Kubernetes: Pod count • Kubernetes: Node - pod allocatable count

9.title: CPU Utilization (Requests)

leftYAxisSettings.label: Kubernetes: Container - CPU requests • Kubernetes: Node - CPU allocatable

10.title: Memory Utilization (Requests)

leftYAxisSettings.label: Kubernetes: Container - memory requests • Kubernetes: Node - memory allocatable

11.title: CPU Utilization (Limits)

leftYAxisSettings.label: Kubernetes: Container - CPU limits • Kubernetes: Node - CPU allocatable

12.title: Memory Utilization (Limits)

leftYAxisSettings.label: Kubernetes: Container - memory limits • Kubernetes: Node - memory allocatable

13.title: CPU Usage per Pod

15.title: CPU Quota
15.query:
timeseries {
  cpu_usage = sum(dt.kubernetes.container.cpu_usage),
  cpu_throttled = sum(dt.kubernetes.container.cpu_throttled),
  requests_cpu = sum(dt.kubernetes.container.requests_cpu),
  limits_cpu = sum(dt.kubernetes.container.limits_cpu)
}, filter: {
  k8s.cluster.name == $Cluster AND
  k8s.node.name == $Node
}, by: { dt.entity.cloud_application_instance, k8s.pod.name },
from: -2m,
nonempty: true,
union: true
| fieldsRemove interval, timeframe
| fieldsAdd cpu_usage = arrayFirst(cpu_usage)
| fieldsAdd cpu_throttled = arrayFirst(cpu_throttled)
| fieldsAdd requests_cpu = arrayFirst(requests_cpu)
| fieldsAdd limits_cpu = arrayFirst(limits_cpu)
| fieldsAdd requests_cpu_percent = cpu_usage / requests_cpu * 100
| fieldsAdd limits_cpu_percent = cpu_usage / limits_cpu * 100
| fieldsAdd cpu_slack = (requests_cpu - cpu_usage) / 1000
| sort cpu_usage desc
| fieldsRename `Name` = k8s.pod.name, `CPU Usage` = cpu_usage, `CPU Throttled` = cpu_throttled, `CPU Requests` = requests_cpu, `CPU Requests %` = requests_cpu_percent, `CPU Limits` = limits_cpu, `CPU Limits %` = limits_cpu_percent, `CPU Slack` = cpu_slack

19.title: Memory Usage per Pod

20.title: Memory Quota
20.query:
timeseries {
  memory_usage = sum(dt.kubernetes.container.memory_working_set),
  requests_memory = sum(dt.kubernetes.container.requests_memory),
  limits_memory = sum(dt.kubernetes.container.limits_memory)
}, filter: {
  k8s.cluster.name == $Cluster AND
  k8s.node.name == $Node
}, by: { dt.entity.cloud_application_instance, k8s.pod.name },
from: -2m,
nonempty: true,
union: true
| fieldsRemove interval, timeframe
| fieldsAdd memory_usage = arrayFirst(memory_usage)
| fieldsAdd requests_memory = arrayFirst(requests_memory)
| fieldsAdd limits_memory = arrayFirst(limits_memory)
| fieldsAdd requests_memory_percent = memory_usage / requests_memory * 100
| fieldsAdd limits_memory_percent = memory_usage / limits_memory * 100
| fieldsAdd memory_slack = (requests_memory - memory_usage)
| sort memory_usage desc
| fieldsRename `Name` = k8s.pod.name, `Memory Usage` = memory_usage, `Memory Requests` = requests_memory, `Memory Requests %` = requests_memory_percent, `Memory Limits` = limits_memory, `Memory Limits %` = limits_memory_percent, `Memory Slack` = memory_slack

21.content:
### Node: [$Node](/ui/intent/dynatrace.kubernetes/entityKubernetesNode/#{"id":"$NodeID"})
Understand pod resource consumption on your Kubernetes nodes. If you don't see data, [start monitoring your cluster](/ui/apps/dynatrace.kubernetes/onboarding) or [explore this dashboard in our Playground](https://wkf10640.apps.dynatrace.com/ui/document/dynatrace.kubernetes.kubernetes-node-pods)
